name: webtechie.be
summary: RaspberryPi and JavaFX at its best. You can find it on Frank Delporte's blog.

name: foojay.io JavaFX Channel
summary: foojay (Friends of OpenJDK) features a great JavaFX channel with fresh content provided by various authors.
tags:: openjdk, tips, tricks, custom controls, raspberry pi

name: Gluon News
summary: Gluon is the co-steward of JavaFX and the Gluon 'News' page is the place to checkout frequently if you want to stay up to date on the latest developments regarding JavaFX.
tags:: mobile, openjfx, embedded, maven, gradle, plugin

name: FX Experience
summary: FX Experience by Jonathan Giles (and Jasper Potts in earlier days) has been the premiere site for JavaFX code, posts, and insights since mid-2009.
tags:: links, tips, tricks, scenic view, controls

name: GUI Garage
summary: Hendrik Ebbers covers various aspects of Java technology on his site and this includes many in-depth posts on JavaFX topics.
tags:: custom controls, speaker, jfx-days, webstart, jug leader

name: Harmonic Code
summary: Gerrit Grunwald's blog contains tons of cool JavaFX widgets. Especially noteworthy is his 'Friday Fun Component' series
tags:: custom controls, widgets, tiles, medusa, fun components, tips, tricks, howto, jug leader

name: Pixel Duke
summary: Enjoy Pedro Vieira articles on fun Java controls, the JMetro theme, and his experience from working on JavaFX projects as a freelancer and consultant.

name: Pixel Perfect
summary: Dirk Lemmermann blogs about JavaFX tips & tricks, custom controls, and 'Real World' applications.

name: VocabHunter Tech and Release Blog
summary: Information about VocabHunter, Santulator and the tech behind them.
